definitions.definition: the part around the neck of a shirt, jacket or coat that usually folds down

examples.text: a coat with a wide collar
I turned up my collar against the wind *(= to keep warm)*.
He always wears **a collar and tie** for work.
He wore a collar and tie for the occasion.
His tie was knotted below his open collar.
She turned up her coat collar for extra warmth.
The shirt had a button-down collar.

definitions.definition: a band of leather or plastic put around the neck of an animal, especially a dog

examples.text: The dog slipped its collar and ran off.

definitions.definition: a band made of a strong material that is put round something, such as a pipe or a machine, to make it stronger or to join two parts together

examples.text: He got very hot under the collar when I asked him where he'd been all day.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French colier, from Latin collare ‘band for the neck, collar’, from collum ‘neck’.
